definition: category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on

sentences.english: We all suppose that fossils are found by accident.
sentences.chinese: 我们都认为化石的发现纯属意外。

sentences.english: Her story was a pure fiction.
I discovered the fossil quite by accident.
sentences.chinese: 我发现这块化石纯属偶然。

sentences.english: A ministry official described the report as groundless.
sentences.chinese: 一位部级官员称这篇报道纯属子虚乌有。

sentences.english: More than purely seems to me from the nonsense of a newspaper to see if the.
sentences.chinese: 以上纯属我从某报看来的一派胡言，看看就算了。

sentences.english: It completely belongs to Chinese internal affair and tolerates no foreign interference to solving Taiwa…
sentences.chinese: 解决台湾问题纯属中国内政，绝不容别国干涉。

sentences.english: My Powa service is voluntary and free of any charges.
sentences.chinese: 我为亡者修颇瓦法纯属自愿和免费服务。

sentences.english: The idea has seemed purely hypothetical, until now.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，这个想法似乎纯属虚构。

sentences.english: End of story, completely true, without any fictional decoration.
sentences.chinese: 故事讲完了，纯属事实，毫无虚构。

sentences.english: I came to live at the farm by happenstance.
sentences.chinese: 我来到该农场住下纯属偶然。

sentences.english: However, the president of Corinthians, Andres Sanches, announced that such rumors are false.
sentences.chinese: 但是科林斯式俱乐部主席宣布这纯属谣言。

sentences.english: It seemed to me that Sir Robert's arguments were nonsensical.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，罗伯特爵士的争辩纯属瞎说。

sentences.english: Written down, these are platitudes, but the effect on the spot is revelatory.
sentences.chinese: 有些文字纯属陈词滥调，但置身当场却能给人以启示。

sentences.english: Obedience is a response, while creation is pure choice, undictated, unrequired.
sentences.chinese: 服从是回应，而创造纯属选择，没有指令，没有要求。

definition: to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
to just talk for the sake of talking
